website_summaries.verdict: A thicker crack climbing glove that's great for protecting your hand in cracks against painful pressure.
pros: Many people who have avoided crack climbing have been able to enjoy it thanks to the thick padding of these gloves
Much more convenient than using tape and more protective as well
cons: A few complaints of the velcro strap snapping
They are tight but you want them that way

customer_reviews.title: I actually enjoy crack climbing with these gloves
customer_reviews.text: I use to hate crack climbing, but then I got these gloves! I would highly recommend these to anyone who uses tape (these will save you time and repeated tape protocols) or doesn't like crack climbing because of the painful pressure spots that tape doesn't help (much). I've had numerous friends try them and buy their own pair. Downsides: 1) it makes your hands wider (which is not always a bad thing, particularly if you're in a slightly larger crack). 2) nothing else
customer_reviews.author: Shelly

customer_reviews.title: They're MUCH more comfortable and convenient than taping up
customer_reviews.text: They're MUCH more comfortable and convenient than taping up. The padding and grippy surface is a godsend for those sore hands. They're reasonably durable for what they are. Obviously they make your hands a bit thicker. Half the time that's great. Half the time that sucks. But it's much easier to take the gloves off to get thinner hands than it is to suddenly sprout thicker hands!
customer_reviews.author: pookey

customer_reviews.title: Have used tape gloves for years, and would even ...
customer_reviews.text: Have used tape gloves for years, and would even re-use my tape gloves for months. The tape gloves did the trick, and because I re-used the glove I didn't use too much tape, just enough to tape them to my wrist. However, once I put them on I would leave them on all day even if every climb wasn't a crack climb. I have tried other crack gloves in the past and they always felt much thicker than tape gloves. The Ocun's feel very similar to tape with the added benefit of being able to remove them for routes where they're not necessary.
customer_reviews.author: Malieka Te' Landis

customer_reviews.title: Seem durable, but too short
customer_reviews.text: I like the the moderate thickness of these but they stop short of the wrist so I have to tape further up to protect the skin and ulnar bone-end prominence.
customer_reviews.author: Colorado Kris

customer_reviews.title: Great Design
customer_reviews.text: Great quality and better than the in-gym brand we purchased previously...(orange ones). These have a good design that allows one to tuck in the velcro strap so it doesn't get caught or rip. Of course, our real climbing friends tell us to toughen up and go bare or with tape but why suffer?
customer_reviews.author: DZ

customer_reviews.title: Love them!
customer_reviews.text: 1st trad crack lead with these gloves. Love them!!!!!!! When I 1st got them I thought I might have gotten too small of a glove. Not the case. They need to be tight. I got a medium and I normally wear a medium. If my hand was any bigger It would not work, but for me, they are rock solid.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: They make butterflies beautifully, though
customer_reviews.text: Keeps the back of your hands from getting torn up by cracks, and is about 10x faster than making tape gloves. The only downside is that they are a bit thick (thicker than the OR version), so they are not ideal for really thin hands. They make butterflies beautifully, though.
customer_reviews.author: Alan Malek

customer_reviews.title: Great little gloves for crack climbing
customer_reviews.text: These didn't actually show up when I ordered them, I think they were misdelivered but I ended up buying a pair elsewhere. I have a small set and I love them. They protect my hands (without sticky tape residue) and the additional padding makes me way more confident with jams. A few friends have complained that they wear out easily but mine haven't yet, I also haven't tried other crack gloves so I don't have a comparison.
customer_reviews.author: Jen

customer_reviews.title: Yes it’s cheating
customer_reviews.text: This makes many crack climbs a fair bit easier. It also saves my skin, saves me time, and makes climbing more enjoyable.
customer_reviews.author: Zebracrossing

customer_reviews.title: Not durable
customer_reviews.text: These are great but they broke on my second use at the wrist. Couldn't get them replaced but will try to repair myself. Otherwise grip and fit are real nice
customer_reviews.author: Alessandro Mazza

customer_reviews.title: Durable and effective
customer_reviews.text: These things are great! The feel is not as good as tape, but they're way easier to put on and take off. Sometimes the thicker part of the wrist strap (with the little hole) catches on the side of the crack, but being more deliberate usually takes care of that, as would taping the wrist, altho I haven't tried that.
customer_reviews.author: NC

customer_reviews.title: I HIGHLY recommend these. They are so much easier than using ...
customer_reviews.text: If you are a crack climber, I HIGHLY recommend these. They are so much easier than using tape and don't shred after use. I will be using these very often
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Ideal crack gloves
customer_reviews.text: Use these on most Yosemite climbs. So convenient. Best closure system. My hands typically are medium size gloves. However mediums we're far too tight and restricted circulation. Went with large on subsequent purchase and they are perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: These are great and helped me a lot on my last trad multi-pitch.
customer_reviews.author: VK

customer_reviews.title: Runs small, round up!
customer_reviews.text: These run small! I’m a 5’8 woman- not a mega giant... ok I am. The point is I measured a med and probably needed a large. They do stretch a bit. My boyfriend opted to cut the middle two fingers out of his and he is happy.
customer_reviews.author: brooke

customer_reviews.title: overall I like them. I'll definitely order another pair when I ...
customer_reviews.text: A little on the small side. I ordered a medium, could probably use a large. But, overall I like them. I'll definitely order another pair when I wear them out.
customer_reviews.author: mike burks

customer_reviews.title: Extremely Well-Designed
customer_reviews.text: These are amazing for learning to climb hand, fist or off-width cracks. Do yourself a favor and use these while you master the various techniques. The fastening mechanism is genius. The thickness and material are perfectly proportionate.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan and Whitney

customer_reviews.title: Solid Crack Climbing Gloves
customer_reviews.text: Solid crack climbing gloves. They stay on really well, provide good friction, and really do a good job of protecting your hands.
customer_reviews.author: Luis Mercado

customer_reviews.title: Great for thin cracks
customer_reviews.text: Great for thin cracks. Not as durable as I would like. The little finger loop broke as did a wrist strap earlier than I would have hoped, but I still bought a new pair.
customer_reviews.author: George Lowe

customer_reviews.title: Durable, good fit!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product, may size up one of I wear these out... definitely do the job l, if a tad on the thick side, but much faster than taping up in the gym or crag!
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Holly

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great gloves, but so expensive now compared to years ago.
customer_reviews.author: Crimp Life

customer_reviews.title: Great gloves, strap keeps breaking.
customer_reviews.text: I really like these gloves and have used them a few dozen times both in indoor and outdoor cracks. My hands feel very secure in the wall and the glove doesn't budge on my hand. My main problem with them is the strap. For whatever reason I'm on my third pair of gloves because the soft hole for the strap keeps getting cut from my pulling of the abrasive velcro strap through it. They need some redesign so it doesn't break. My first pair lasted four months, my second lasted one and a half...
customer_reviews.author: Brice

customer_reviews.title: These are great gloves. These are comfortable
customer_reviews.text: These are great gloves. These are comfortable. They don't slip during crack climbing. You get to keep the hair on the back of your hands. I will probably not tape up again. They are a little thicker than tape but I adapted my climbing around it pretty quickly.
customer_reviews.author: john clark

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Best hand jammers ever. Fist Jams never felt so good :-)
customer_reviews.author: Ben S.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great for training on crack. Much faster than taping up every time!
customer_reviews.author: eshvar60@hotmail.com

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Hard to get velcro securely closed at wrist, hence it comes loose while climbing.
customer_reviews.author: A GM

customer_reviews.title: they are not bad at all - jams feel pretty solid and absolutely ...
customer_reviews.text: I never used crack climbing gloves before, just tape when I expect falling but after watching video of Tommy Caldwell using those, decided to try. You know, they are not bad at all - jams feel pretty solid and absolutely no abrasions, bruising or swelling of hands. Cons: drastically reduced sensitivity (which is expected) and no protection for thumb knuckle - a serious omission, it could really help fist jamming.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: They are like having rock shoes for your hands
customer_reviews.text: I'm on a year long road trip in my van and climb probably 5 days a week. Even with the miles I've put on them, these gloves have never worn out. They are like having rock shoes for your hands! I've recommended them to ~10 people at this point, who have all purchased them and love them as much as I do. Get em and send hard!
customer_reviews.author: max

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed with durability
customer_reviews.text: I really hate to give these a 1-star but the durability was disappointing. I bought these gloves about 2 months ago and absolutely loved them. Very comfortable and good grip when Climbing. However, after maybe 10 Climbing days the thumb strap tore completely and some of the other seams are starting to come apart as well. I would love to try another pair but I can’t afford $45 every 2-3 months... :(
customer_reviews.author: Maggie Jaicomo

product_meta.title: Ocun Crack Climbing Gloves
product_meta.description: These are the new and improved ultimate gloves for crack climbing. Thin rubber protects the backs of your hands while providing maximum sensitivity and friction when jamming. With durable sticky rubber, quick-close velcro, and a thin profile, the Ocun Crack Gloves are an eco-friendly alternative to tape. Spend less time taping up and more time climbing hard. Microfiber stretch suede and highly sensitive adhesive rubber for maximum friction. Five new sizes including XS, S, M, L, and XL with quick closure system - weighing only 57 g (2 oz.) Made in the Czech Republic.
feature_bullets: Material: microfiber stretch suede and high sensitive adhesive rubber for maximum friction
The shape of the gloves has been improved to offer greater comfort and hand protection whilst crack climbing
Rubber now conceals the quick Velcro closure preventing unfastening when hard crack climbing

Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
